meanings.definition: Drive or force (an attack or attacker) back or away.
meanings.sent1: The strong smell of garlic repels mosquitoes from biting me.
meanings.sent2: The scarecrow in the field repels birds and keeps them away from the crops.
meanings.sent3: The loud music from the party repels the neighbors, who prefer peace and quiet.
meanings.sent4: Her confident attitude repels negativity like a shield against criticism.
meanings.sent5: The bright light repels the darkness, revealing hidden corners of the room.
